creator: Datadromeda AB
descriptionHtml:
With Pattern Keeper you can view and annotate PDF cross stitch charts. There is an initial free trial period then there is a one time charge to continue to use the app.

*DISCLAIMER-IMPORTANT*
The app is still in beta and works great with some charts but will not work at all with other. In general the app works best with full coverage pieces and backstitches are not supported. Also note that scans do not work. It has to be an original PDF pattern.

The app is tested with charts from Paine Free Crafts, Tilton Crafts, Haed, Artecy, Charting Creations Golden Kite and The Cross Stitch Studio. However there is no guarantee that all charts from these vendors will work. I'm NOT affiliated with any of the listed designers and all questions about compatibility should be posed to me not the designers.
*END DISCLAIMER*


View chart as one continuous pattern. Easily stitch over page breaks

Highlight symbols to see where to stitch. When highlighting the thread number of the symbol is shown. No need to flip back and forth between the chart and the legend.

Mark finished stitches. Select easily by swiping horizontally, vertically or even on the diagonal. It is also possible to mark an entire 10 by 10 square. If you import a chart that already have annotations in it we try to import that as your current progress. Finished stitches are displayed in color making it easy to navigate and compare with your stitching.

Mark where you parked your threads and in what corner of the square they are parked.

Keep motivated by tracking of your progress. Get a tally of how many stitches you finished today and in total and see how many stitches are left of each thread.
descriptionShort: View your PDF cross stitch charts, highlight symbols and mark of your progress

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: This release adds the option to set up shortcuts using double clicks. Shortcuts can be configured in the chart settings view. If no shortcuts are set, which is the default, then the app will function the exact same as before.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:

Support for many new designers and new export option to export just the progress without the PDF which is faster and more stable.

Increased max zoom, selected thread visible when thread list minimized, fix for the bug where the colored squares move around weirdly on some devices, improved input of blended colors and many more minor fixes.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
This release contains many improvements for the display in the chart view.
Center mark, Dark mode, Color for page breaks, Color for selected stitches, Flat color for finished stitches, Back button, Configurable daily stitch reset time.

Also lots of stability improvements and bug fixes as well as improved support for Athebyne Craftworks, Stitch Fiddle, and White Raven

New is also that the app has been translated into several languages.

This release contains many improvements for the display in the chart view.
Center mark, Dark mode, Color for page breaks, Color for selected stitches, Flat color for finished stitches, Back button, Configurable daily stitch reset time.

Also lots of stability improvements and bug fixes as well as improved support for Athebyne Craftworks, Stitch Fiddle, and White Raven

New is also that the app has been translated into several languages.

title: Pattern Keeper - Cross Stitch Progress Tracker

creator: Datadromeda AB
descriptionHtml:
With Pattern Keeper you can view and annotate PDF cross stitch charts. There is an initial, month-long, free trial period then there is a one time charge of around 9 USD to continue to use the app.

*DISCLAIMER-IMPORTANT*
The app is still in beta and works great with some charts but will not work with others. Backstitches and fractional stitches are not supported. Scans and images can be used but only with limited functionality.

The app is tested with charts from Paine Free Crafts, Tilton Crafts, Heaven and Earth Designs, Artecy, Charting Creations, Golden Kite, Cross Stitch 4 Everyone, Orenco Originals, Advanced Cross Stitch, and The Cross Stitch Studio. However, there is no guarantee that all charts from these vendors will work. I'm NOT affiliated with any of the listed designers and all questions about compatibility should be posed to me, not the designers.
*END DISCLAIMER*


View your chart as one continuous pattern. Easily stitch over page breaks.

Highlight symbols to see where to stitch. When highlighting, the thread number of that symbol is shown. There is no need to flip back and forth between the chart and the legend.

Mark finished stitches. Select easily by swiping horizontally, vertically, or even on the diagonal. It is also possible to mark an entire 10 by 10 square. If you import a chart that already has annotations in it, we try to import that as your current progress. Finished stitches are displayed in color, making it easy to navigate and compare with your stitching.

Mark where you parked your threads and in what corner of the square they are parked.

Keep motivated by tracking your progress. Get a tally of how many stitches you finished, today and in total, and see how many stitches are left for each thread.

descriptionShort: View your PDF cross stitch charts, highlight symbols and mark of your progress

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
This release contains the ability to change the name of the chart in the chart list and the option to show the mockup as a thumbnail instead of the first page of the PDF.

There are also several new advanced import options to make it possible to import some charts that did not work before.

New is also the ability to shift the 10x10 grids and change the labels to match charts that are not labeled from the top left.

descriptionShort: View your PDF cross stitch charts, highlight symbols and mark off your progress

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
This release contains the option to sort the thread list on the number of stitches left as well as an option to hide threads with no stitches left.

There is also a new chart menu option: Reset progress. It removes the progress from a chart so you can start over.

And as always there are some minor bug fixes and stability fixes.
